pageContext.claim: “And we have catch and release and we have chain migration, where somebody comes in and brings the whole family. Bring them all: your grandparents, your brothers, your sisters, your cousins. The craziest thing I've ever seen. Put in by Democrats.”
pageContext.analysis: The United States immigration system favors family-based migration and has allowed citizens to bring in their relatives for many decades, with some restrictions. These laws go back to the early 20th century and had wide bipartisan support when they passed. They were not "put in by Democrats."
